title: C_COMPLEX_OBJECT
description: Constraint on complex objects, i.e. any object that consists of other object constraints.
$comments: Defined in Aom2 IM, inherits from C_DEFINED_OBJECT

parent.description: Parent node, except in the case of the top of a tree, i.e. root `C_COMPLEX_OBJECT` of an archetype definition.

rm_type_name.description: Reference model type that this node corresponds to.

occurrences.description:
Occurrences of this object node in the data, under the owning attribute. Upper limit can only be greater than 1 if owning attribute has a cardinality of more than 1.
Only set if it overrides the parent archetype in the case of specialised archetypes, or else the occurrences inferred from the underlying reference model existence and/or cardinality of the containing attribute.

node_id.description:
Semantic identifier of this node, used to dis-tinguish sibling nodes. All nodes must have a node_id; for nodes under a container `C_ATTRIBUTE`, the id must be an id-code must be defined in the archetype terminology. For valid structures, all node ids are id-codes.
For `C_PRIMITIVE_OBJECTs`, it will have the special value `Primitive_node_id`.

is_deprecated.description: True if this node and by implication all sub-nodes are deprecated for use.

sibling_order.description: Optional indicator of order of this node with respect to another sibling. Only meaningful in a specialised archetype for a `C_OBJECT` within a `C_ATTRIBUTE` with `_is_multiple_` = True.

default_value.description: Default value set in a template, and present in an operational template. Generally limited to leaf and near-leaf nodes.

attributes.description: List of constraints on attributes of the reference model type represented by this object.

attribute_tuples.description: List of attribute tuple constraints under this object constraint, if any.

codes_conformant.description: True if a_child_code conforms to a_parent_code in the sense of specialisation, i.e. is a_child_code the same as or more specialised than a_parent_code.

is_adl_code.description: True if a_code is any kind of ADL archetype local code.

is_id_code.description: True if a_code is an 'id' code.

is_value_code.description: True if a_code is an 'at' code, i.e. a code representing a single terminology item.

is_value_set_code.description: True if a_code is an 'ac' code, i.e. a code referring to a terminologyvalue set.

is_redefined_code.description:
A code has been specialised if there is a non-zero code index anywhere above the last index e.g. 

* at0.0.1 -> False
* at1.0.1 -> True

code_exists_at_level.description: Is `a_code' valid at level `a_level' or less, i.e. if we remove its trailing specialised part corresponding to specialisation below `a_level', and then any trailing '.0' pieces, do we end up with a valid code? If so it means that the code corresponds to a real node from `a_level' or higher.

is_prohibited.description: True if this `C_OBJECT` node is prohibited, i.e. if its occurrences is 0..0.

has_path.description: True if the relative path a_path exists at this node.

path.description: Path of this node relative to root of archetype.

c_conforms_to.description:
True if constraints represented by this node, ignoring any sub-parts, are narrower or the same as other. 
Typically used during validation of special-ised archetype nodes.

c_congruent_to.description:
True if constraints represented by this node contain no further redefinitions with respect to the node `_other_`, with the exception of node_id redefnition in `C_OBJECT` nodes. 

Typically used to test if an inherited node locally contains any constraints.

is_second_order_constrained.description: True if there is a second order constraint such as a tuple constraint on this node.

is_root.description: True if this node is the root of the tree.

is_leaf.description: True if this node is a terminal node in the tree structure, i.e. having no child nodes.

specialisation_depth.description: Level of specialisation of this archetype node, based on its node_id. The value 0 corresponds to non-specialised, 1 to first-level specialisation and so on. The level is the same as the number of ‘.’ characters in the node_id code. If node_id is not set, the return value is -1, signifying that the specialisation level should be determined from the nearest parent `C_OBJECT` node having a node_id.

occurrences_conforms_to.description: True if this node `_occurrences_` conforms to `_other.occurrences_`; `other' is assumed to be in a flat archetype.

other.description: C_OBJECT from a flat parent archetype.

node_id_conforms_to.description: True if this node id conforms to other.node_id, which includes the ids being identical; other is assumed to be in a flat archetype.

any_allowed.description: True if any value (i.e. instance) of the reference model type would be allowed. Redefined in descendants.

valid_value.description: True if `_a_value_` is valid with respect to constraint expressed in concrete instance of this type.

prototype_value.description: Generate a prototype value from this constraint object.

has_default_value.description: True if there is an assumed value.
